verbs.description: foreprepare (third-person singular simple present foreprepares, present participle forepreparing, simple past and past participle foreprepared)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To prepare beforehand or in advance
examples: "[...] He first preacheth in English to the English audience, and then the same matter is delivered to the Indians, by an interpreter, whom with much pains, Mr. Gookin hath foreprepared."
